Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored the final 12 points for the Warriors to will them to a 120-117 victory over Klay Thompson and the Dallas Mavericks at Chase Center on Tuesday.
Stephen Curry had a complete game, leading all players in points (37) and assists (9) while shooting 60.0 percent from two (9-for-15) and 41.7 percent from three (5-for-12)
Post-Match Reflections: Klay Thompson said after competing against his Splash Brother for the first time in an NBA game, 'It was fun to match up with Steph, and it hurts to be on the other side of one of his flurries.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors were plus-24 with Curry on the floor and minus-21 when he sat.
Stephen Curry's four steals tied a season-high.
The Dubs were plus-24 with Curry on the floor and minus-21 when he sat.
Others: The article mentions the Warriors' two NBA Cup matchups against the Dallas Mavericks and the Memphis Grizzlies in Week 4 of the 2024-25 regular season.
